intro: Lastrea microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited lastrea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. The plant is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in spring. It has a compact growth habit and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
